text: A crack in the thick outer glass had our hearts skip a beat. In that split second, both our minds went blank. I feel like this is the moment when oneâ€™s life is supposed to flash before the eyes.

The heart-stopping crack, a flash of deep nothing, then a minute of calm. Followed by another, and another. I pulled the plug on the operation immediately and began our gradual ascent. We had reached the bottom of the trench, we had done what we came here to do.

Our feet are now firmly on the deck of the Santa Maria. What we witnessed with our eyes down there was unique, without a doubt. Odd fish at staggering depths, great storms of algae. We return with no readings, photographs or proof of any these peculiarities -- but what we saw inside ourselves in that chilling moment was deeply profound beyond anything I had hoped to find.
